Package kdl.prox.nsi2.graph

Interface Summary
Graph The Graph interface is the lower-layer of the NSI package, encapsulating the access to the underlying database: APP ------ SEARCH ------ NSI ------ GRAPH All the Graph layer has to do is return a list of the neighbors of a particular node.
 

Class Summary
ArtificialGraph A Graph that is not based on the Monet database, but on a small network that is passed in to the constructor
CachedOnDiskGraph intermediate solution, keeps an in-memory cache of some of the links.
InMemoryGraph Very fast and very simple graph, which pre-fetches all the links and keeps them in memory Of course it works when all the links fit in memory.
InMemoryWeightedGraph Like the inMemory graph, but instead of setting the weight of the neighboring node to 1, it actually uses the 'weight' link attribute to get the weight of the connection to the neighbors
Node This is the basic representation of a neighboring node: id, and the weight of the link connecting to it
OnDiskGraph This Graph implementation leaves everyting in the Monet side: for every call to getNeighbors, there is a read from Monet.
OnDiskWeightedGraph This Graph implementation leaves everyting in the Monet side: for every call to getNeighbors, there is a read from Monet.
